page.title: 04THE WATER SCHEME IN EDAY
page.content: In 1982 a water scheme was built in Eday which can supply the whole island with mains water. Before this time every household had its own well and/or rain water tanks. The fresh water we now get comes from underground streams. The water is pumped up through pumping stations on the west side of the island, through pipes to the water tanks, one at the north end and two at the south end of the island. Not all of the people use this facility, some of the older inhabitants of the island still have rain water tanks and some still use their wells. The new water scheme has helped many people because now they do not have to go to and fro from the wells and it makes the watering of cattle and sheep much simpler and quicker.
